KEY UPCOMING JPM CALLS - APAC COMMODITIES (HK time)27 Aug12pm HKTChina Anti-Involution (Lunch in HK): Chems &amp; RefiningASKSpeakers: Wendy Liu (JPM Strategist) &amp; Parsley Ong (JPM Head of APAC Energy &amp; Chems)29 Aug11.45am HKTReliance: Valuations still AttractiveClick to RegisterSpeakers: Sanjay Mookim, Latika Chopra &amp; Ankur Rudra (JPM Energy, Consumer &amp; Telco Analysts)1 Sep12.30pm HKTAus Mining - Learnings from EarningsClick to RegisterSpeakers: Lyndon Fagan, Al Harvey &amp; Milan Tomic (JPM Australian Mining Team)2 Sep4pm HKTPTT Group - Is Downstream Restructuring a Game Changer?Click to RegisterSpeakers: Sumedh Samant (JPM ASEAN Energy &amp; Chems), Love Sharma (Asia Credit Research)3 Sep10.30am HKTAsia Ex Metals &amp; Mining: Learnings from EarningsClick to RegisterSpeakers: Avery Chan, Vibhav Zutshi &amp; Benny Kurniawan (JPM China, India &amp; Indo Materials)4 Sep3pm HKTPetrochemicals: Addressing Anti Involution &amp; Government ActionsTBASpeakers: Parsley Ong &amp; Sumedh Samant (JPM Asia Energy &amp; Chems)
CHINA: First Takes: Chalco & CNOOC in line but dividend beats, Raising Target price on Zijin post call

CHALCO (2600 HK): Q2 net profits came in at Rmb3.53B bang in line with JPMe (Rmb3.51B)& Consensus, representing \(28\%\) of JPM FY25e, and \(29\%\) of Cons FY25, flat y/y. The Company will pay an interim dividend of RMB0.123 (tax inclusive, (RMB2.11 billion tax inclusive). Representing a \(30\%\) payout, which is in line with their full year but above interim expectations. FY25 GUIDANCE: Nothing financial but operational targets given: metallurgical- grade alumina output of 16.81 mt (down from 16.87Mt in 24), refined alumina output of 4.46 mt (up from 4.31Mt in FY24), primary aluminum (including alloy) output of 7.8mt (up from 7.61Mt in 2024), raw coal output of 14.1 million tonnes, and power generation of 41.2 billion kWh. Avery is OW on further dividend hike potential at full year.

CNOOC (883 HK): 2Q NP of Rmb33bn, in- line with JPMe of Rmb33.1bn, but DPS of HK\$0.73/ Rmb0.66 (45% payout) beat JPMe of Rmb0.59 (40% payout, flat y/y). Similar to Petrochina, CNOOC hiked its interim dividend payout ratio from \(40\%\) to \(45\%\) . However, absolute DPS was still down by \(- 2\%\) y/y as 1H25 NP fell by \(- 13\%\) y/y (vs. Petrochina \(- 5\%\) y/y). Analyst briefing later today. Production guidance for 780- 800Mmbc \((+7 - 10\%\) y/y), 2026 at 810- 830Mmbc \((+4\%\) y/y). Parsley is UW on falling crude prices and negative risk for their US/Canada assets. Parsley Note

ZIJIN MINING (2899 HK): Avery came away from call impressed with strong production growth & profitability. He flags that rising gold unit costs \((+8\%\) q/q) should not be a concern, as largely due to one offs related to consolidation of Aykem project and rental fleet in La Arena being replaced with electric trucks. Management expects to extend mine life from 2027 to 2044 which will bring down fixed costs. Unit costs for gold to come down in 2H25 too. Volume growth will be intact despite kamoia seismic activity, and nonc ore assets will be lumped together into rare precious metals unit. Gold spinoff could come as soon as september - We have revised up our FY25- 27 earnings forecasts by \(5 - 7\%\) to reflect the positive price outlook and solid production growth. Our revised Zijin- A PT of Rmb26.5 is based on \(1.0x\) P/NAV and implies an inexpensive FY26E 13x P/E and \(9.7x\) EV/EBITDA. Our Zijin- H PT of HK\$28 Avery's note here.
AUS MATERIALS: First Takes: MIN (+), PRU (+), PDN (+), SFR (- ), LYC (+), IGO (- ), BGL (- ), S32 (- )

MIN - EBITDA \(\) 901m\(, 10\%\) ahead of JPMe, \(8\%\) ahead of cons. Onslow 30- 33Mt vs our 32Mt, costs\) \ \(54 - 59 / t\) vs our \(\) 53\(t. Beat on earnings positive but ND pre - reported + FY26 guide marginally softer than JPMe. Market will trip on the onslow costs which may overshadow good result.

PRU - Consolidated NPAT \(\) 8422\(mm, inline with JPMe, 14\%\) beat to Cons, EBITDA \(\) 3740\(mm, 4\% /7\%\) beat to JPMe/ Cons, Final Div 5cps, unfranked. Takes total FY25 Div to 7.5Acps, 19\%\) beat to JPMe and Cons.

PDN - EBITDA \(\) 824m\(vs Cons A\) 5m, Revenue of\)\\(179m\) in line with JPMe, net cash was \(\) 2.24\(m vs JPM\) \ \(10.6m\) LYC - Underlying NPAT miss, but revenue a decent beat vs. JPMe. Capital raise to be the main game, \(\) 750m\(. Mkt to likely question Samarium\)\sqrt[3]{Yttrium}\) investment versus NdPr / DyTbr related expansions.
SFR \(\) 1\(BITDA and Net debt pre - reported, NPAT in line with JPM and cons.
IGO - Underlying NPAT loss of \(\) 173m\(vs JPM\) \ \(87m\) loss and cons \(\) 139m\(, Underlying EBITDA loss of\) \ \(43m\) , different to June quarterly disclosure of \(\) 14m\(loss
BGL - NPAT was a beat to cons by \(9\%\) but Net debt position of \(\) 191m\(much higher than JPMe/cons of\) \ \(91m /\) \ \(96m\)
S32 - EBITDA inline vs cons, NPAT is a miss and ND @ \(\) 123m\(vs JPM\) \ \(93m\)
Lyndon & Al are hosting a results brief on Monday 12.30pm at T. Let us know if keen to join.
